toggle.heading: Here are the best liberal arts colleges in the U.S.

hero.title: National Liberal Arts Colleges
hero.description: The National Liberal Arts Colleges, including schools like Colby College and Wesleyan University, emphasize undergraduate education and award at least half of their degrees in the liberal arts fields of study.
hero.subtitle: Here are the best liberal arts colleges in the U.S.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1860, Simpson College is a private institution. Simpson College follows a 4-4-1-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.
Founded in 1836, Wesleyan College is a private institution. The school has 74.2% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at Wesleyan College is 8:1.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1845, Wittenberg University is a private institution. Wittenberg University offers a Greek system, where 27 percent of the student body is involved in a sorority and 30% is involved in a fraternity.
Founded in 1836, Emory and Henry College is a private institution. Emory and Henry College follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1825, Centenary College is a private institution. The school has 72.2% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at Centenary College is 9:1.
Founded in 1889, Gordon College is a private institution.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Guilford College is a small, liberal arts school in Greensboro, North Carolina. Students can cross-register for courses at nearby schools, including Elon University and the University of North Carolina—Greensboro.

institution.footnote: This school declined to fill out the U.S. News & World Report main statistical survey. Data that appears is from either what the school reported in previous years or from another source, such as the National Center for Education Statistics.

acceptanceRate.noteText: Data reported to U.S. News in previous years

satAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

actAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

items.blurb: Founded in 1946, Marlboro College is a private institution.

satAvg.noteText: In reporting SAT/ACT scores, the school did not include all students for whom it had scores or refused to tell U.S. News whether all students with scores had been included.

actAvg.noteText: In reporting SAT/ACT scores, the school did not include all students for whom it had scores or refused to tell U.S. News whether all students with scores had been included.

items.blurb: Morehouse College is the only four-year liberal arts institution that’s historically black and all male. It has a reputation for providing an academic foundation for black men. The university attracts well-known achievers in politics and the arts to speak at college events. Former president Barack Obama, congressman John Lewis and political commentator Marc Lamont Hill have all addressed the campus community or led a class. The school is located three miles from downtown Atlanta and is a member of the Atlanta University Center Consortium, an academic partnership between Morehouse, Clark Atlanta University and Spelman College. Morehouse has a National Fellowships and Awards Committee to help students apply for scholarships and fellowships, and the college houses a research institute, entrepreneurship center and the Morehouse School of Medicine.

items.blurb: Founded in 1967, Purchase College--SUNY is a public institution. Purchase College--SUNY follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

utag_data.stitial_fact: During the fall 2015 admission cycle, 79 percent of international graduate applications came from Chinese and Indian nationals.
